TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE , residing in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by Mr Graff , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant suffers from cancer . Since an operation in DATE she has been treated with “ NORP ” , a medicine which is not registered in the NORP pharmacopeia ( NORP ) . The applicant asked ORG ( Gebietskrankenkassa ) to reimburse the various costs of her treatment . On CARDINAL DATE ORG refused to meet the costs .

On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG ( Arbeits- und ORG ) against ORG , requesting the reimbursement of the treatment costs . On CARDINAL DATE ORG appointed an expert who delivered his opinion in DATE .
On DATE a witness was heard and the expert opinion was discussed . On DATE the proceedings were adjourned because ORG was expected to deliver a judgment concerning “ LOC .

On DATE the applicant appealed against the adjournment , which was quashed by ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) . On DATE a witness was heard . In DATE another expert delivered his opinion . On DATE the expert delivered a supplementary opinion . A further hearing appears to have been held on DATE . On DATE the applicant gave notice that CARDINAL witnesses were going to be absent for some time and asked the court to schedule the following hearing no sooner than DATE . On DATE ORG appointed another expert who DATE after having been admonished by the judge CARDINAL times – finally delivered his opinion in DATE . On DATE a hearing was held to discuss the expert opinion .
On DATE the applicant ’s counsel submitted documents in NORP which were translated into NORP by DATE .
On DATE the expert delivered a supplementary opinion on the basis of the submitted documents .
On DATE the court fixed the date for a hearing on DATE , but at the request of the applicant counsel ’s postponed the hearing until DATE .
On DATE the hearing was postponed until DATE due to the judge ’s illness . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s counsel requested a further postponement .

On DATE , after the hearing , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action , referring to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Allgemeines Sozialversicherungsgesetz ) which states that the treatment provided has to be sufficient and appropriate but must not exceed what is actually necessary . The court found that the mere fact that “ NORP ” was not registered in the NORP pharmacopoeia did not in itself prevent the reimbursement of treatment costs . However , in the applicant ’s case , registered medicines would have had the same curative effects and , given the evidence produced during the proceedings ( submissions of the parties and witnesses , expert opinions ) , their prescription could not be considered unreasonable or unacceptable . In addition , the “ NORP ” treatment cost CARDINAL times as much . Besides , the court noted that no curative effect had been proved . Therefore the “ LOC treatment was neither a necessary nor an appropriate treatment within the meaning of section CARDINAL of LAW .
On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . The decision was served on DATE .
